And that shows a lot of problems with the MMR system. It punishes you for winning. 

If you're a gold 5 playing at a gold 3 level, then you should easily climb to gold 3, by facing off against other gold 5s and gold4s.

But the MMR hinders you for having a high winrate. Despite you playing as good as a gold 3, the progress is slowed down by pairing you up against other better people, getting up ranks is much more grindy. Instead of just 20ish games to get to gold 3, you now have 30ish games, because you're being paired with and against plats and high tier golds. 

There's also the 2/3 games and 3/5 games system, and provisionals(X/10), which have issues of their own, but those have been addressed.

True the system punishes you for winning too much because it aims at putting you in that 50% win rate balanced state.

However like i said it compensates by giving you more LP when your MMR is higher than your rank.
Forced 50% win rates is anti-balance.

First of all 50% is half of 100% which means it's the very definition of balance.

I think you meant ANTI-FUN not anti-balance... However, look at it from this angle:

**This matchmaking forces constant improvement in each player.**

The system constantly matches you against people who are your own level so to actually climb and progress (have more than 50% win rate) you need to constantly improve and grow as a player. This is not just on a game to game basis but each time you are unloaded on the rift. If you have 50% chance to win based on statistics, then the game is actually forcing you to get better than you were before starting it so you can take the precious LP. 

You don't get good by stomping against bad players.

U git gud by losing to better players and learning from it.

**What I understood **
Does that mean if I were to queue with a 3 man+, we would get matched with a higher elo to compensate the difference?
The people I was queuing with were gold 5 (at the time of starting) and I was silver 2, So I thought our ranks were relatively close.

MMR - Match making rating => It is the thing that actually decides how good you are and not the shiny badges.

It's calculated based on your overall performance in games (KDA, dmg to champs, Gold and Win Ratio) relative to the performance of others.

If your MMR is higher than that of people placed in the same league as you - then you get more LP on win and lose less on defeats.

For instance if you are 1500 MMR and play with your friend who is also 1500 MMR.

You 2 lose 10 games together but you got S ranks on every game and he got D ranks. By the end of game 10 both of you would have lost MMR but your friend would lose more and then on the 11th game if you win you would get something like 14 LP and he will get 12-13.

Win ratio decides MMR the most but as i said performance influences it.

This is the reason when i smurfed my account and got 10 wins on Akali in a row pub stomping with S and S+ ranks I got matched against Plat 1-3 while being in silver 1 promos.
